definition: to churn out large quantities without regard for quality (idiom); rough and slipshod work
system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]
to make/to build/to manufacture/to invent/to fabricate/to go to/party (in a lawsuit or legal agreement)/crop/classifier for crops

sentences.english: The film is a piece of schlock.
sentences.chinese: 这是一部粗制滥造的电影片子。

sentences.english: Some TV plays are made in a rough and slipshod way.
sentences.chinese: 有些电视剧是粗制滥造的。

sentences.english: He has been churning out detective stories for more than ten years.
sentences.chinese: 十多年来，他一直在大量粗制滥造侦探小说。

sentences.english: By the late 19th century a local factory churned out violins.
sentences.chinese: 19世纪末，当地一家工厂粗制滥造出大量小提琴。

definition: lit. to play the yu 竽 mouth organ to make up numbers (idiom); fig. to make up the numbers with inferior products/to masquerade as having an ability/token member of a group
to skimp on the job and stint on materials (idiom)/jerry-building/sloppy work
to pass off fish eyes for pearls/to pass off fake products as genuine (idiom)
when radishes are selling fast, one doesn't take the time to wash the soil off them (idiom)/fig. when business is booming, merchants tend to offer goods of inferior quality
pinyin: luo2 bo5 kuai4 le5 bu4 xi3 ni2

definition: sensationalism/vulgar claptrap to please the crowds/playing to the gallery/demagogy
lit. to hang a sheep's head while selling dog meat (idiom)/fig. to cheat/dishonest advertising/wicked deeds carried out under banner of virtue
pinyin: gua4 yang2 tou2 mai4 gou3 rou4
